pullrequest.title: Syntax for remote worker brokers and secondary control systems

content.raw:
Shouldn't we add the `com_port` keyword \(or similar\) to the `Device` class constructor?

I think this would make sense as it would allow any device to be used remotely without modifications to it's individual device class.

‌

Update: Or is the idea to allway use the keyword that gets passed to the `BLACS_connection` ?  If that is the case that might cause problems with other processing of to the keyword before it gets passed to `BLACS_connection` or expected formats for `BLACS_connection`.
content.html:
Shouldn't we add the com_port keyword (or similar) to the Device class constructor?

I think this would make sense as it would allow any device to be used remotely without modifications to it's individual device class.

‌

Update: Or is the idea to allway use the keyword that gets passed to the BLACS_connection ? If that is the case that might cause problems with other processing of to the keyword before it gets passed to BLACS_connection or expected formats for BLACS_connection.

pullrequest.title: Syntax for remote worker brokers and secondary control systems

content.raw:
Today I checked all devices and it seems that my concern with the BLACS\_connection being processed only seems to apply to NovaTechDDS9M. I think we should do one of 2 things:

* add a new keyword `remote_connection` for the `Device` class with a default of `None`. This keyword would receive the string name of the `_RemoteBLACSConnection` to be used.
* Set some ground rules on how the BLACS\_connection is to be formed to avoid problems with the processing of the keyword to form the BLACS\_connection
content.html:
Today I checked all devices and it seems that my concern with the BLACS_connection being processed only seems to apply to NovaTechDDS9M. I think we should do one of 2 things:

  • add a new keyword remote_connection for the Device class with a default of None. This keyword would receive the string name of the _RemoteBLACSConnection to be used.
  • Set some ground rules on how the BLACS_connection is to be formed to avoid problems with the processing of the keyword to form the BLACS_connection

pullrequest.title: Syntax for remote worker brokers and secondary control systems

content.raw:
So, the idea is that `self.BLACS_connection` holds the connection string. The keyword argument is dependent on the device \(com\_port, usb, board\_number, etc\) and so can't be standardised into the `Device` class.

What is the issue with the NovatechDDS9m?. It looks to me like it will end up as `'control2|com14,115200'`. I'm expecting that the code in BLACS will split on the delimiter `|` and check if the beginning matches the current instance of BLACS and then forward on the end to the device tab for instantiation \(or alternatively, the device tabs will be updated to strip out everything prior to `|`\). So yes, we need guidelines to ensure that:

* labscript device classes don't prepend something to the com\_port or equivalent and don't use the same delimiter as the `_RemoteBLACSConnection`
* BLACS device classes know to strip off everything prior to the `_RemoteBLACSConnection`delimiter

Is there anything else I've missed?
content.html:
So, the idea is that self.BLACS_connection holds the connection string. The keyword argument is dependent on the device (com_port, usb, board_number, etc) and so can't be standardised into the Device class.

What is the issue with the NovatechDDS9m?. It looks to me like it will end up as 'control2|com14,115200'. I'm expecting that the code in BLACS will split on the delimiter | and check if the beginning matches the current instance of BLACS and then forward on the end to the device tab for instantiation (or alternatively, the device tabs will be updated to strip out everything prior to |). So yes, we need guidelines to ensure that:

  • labscript device classes don't prepend something to the com_port or equivalent and don't use the same delimiter as the _RemoteBLACSConnection
  • BLACS device classes know to strip off everything prior to the _RemoteBLACSConnectiondelimiter

Is there anything else I've missed?

pullrequest.title: Syntax for remote worker brokers and secondary control systems

content.raw:
The NovaTechDDS9M was just a example for a device modifying/assembling its BLACS\_connection. I had the concern that there could be something prepended to the BLACS\_connection or that the same delimiter could be used in this processing. If we agree on the guidelines of your first bullet point everything should be just fine.

‌
content.html:
The NovaTechDDS9M was just a example for a device modifying/assembling its BLACS_connection. I had the concern that there could be something prepended to the BLACS_connection or that the same delimiter could be used in this processing. If we agree on the guidelines of your first bullet point everything should be just fine.

Ok, great! I'll merge this in.

On a related note, I'm planning on slowly working my way through the current set of pull requests over the next few weeks, starting with things I consider are easy to merge in!
